dandelion.tools.define_clonesÂ¶

dandelion.tools.define_clones(self, dist=None, action='set', model='ham', norm='len', doublets='drop', fileformat='airr', ncpu=None, dirs=None, outFilePrefix=None, key_added=None, verbose=False)[source]Â¶

Find clones using changeoâs DefineClones.py.

Only callable for BCR data at the moment.

Parameters

  • self (Dandelion, DataFrame, str) â Dandelion object, pandas DataFrame in changeo/airr format, or file path to changeo/airr file after clones have been determined.

  • dist (float, optional) â The distance threshold for clonal grouping. If None, the value will be retrieved from the Dandelion class .threshold slot.

  • action (str) â Specifies how to handle multiple V(D)J assignments for initial grouping. Default is âsetâ. The âfirstâ action will use only the first gene listed. The âsetâ action will use all gene assignments and construct a larger gene grouping composed of any sequences sharing an assignment or linked to another sequence by a common assignment (similar to single-linkage).

  • model (str) â Specifies which substitution model to use for calculating distance between sequences. Default is âhamâ. The âhamâ model is nucleotide Hamming distance and âaaâ is amino acid Hamming distance. The âhh_s1fâ and âhh_s5fâ models are human specific single nucleotide and 5-mer content models, respectively, from Yaari et al, 2013. The âmk_rs1nfâ and âmk_rs5nfâ models are mouse specific single nucleotide and 5-mer content models, respectively, from Cui et al, 2016. The âm1n_compatâ and âhs1f_compatâ models are deprecated models provided backwards compatibility with the âm1nâ and âhs1fâ models in Change-O v0.3.3 and SHazaM v0.1.4. Both 5-mer models should be considered experimental.

  • norm (str) â Specifies how to normalize distances. Default is âlenâ. ânoneâ (do not normalize), âlenâ (normalize by length), or âmutâ (normalize by number of mutations between sequences).

  • doublets (str) â Option to control behaviour when dealing with heavy chain âdoubletsâ. Default is âdropâ. âdropâ will filter out the doublets while âcountâ will retain only the highest umi count contig.

  • fileformat (str) â format of V(D)J file/objects. Default is âairrâ. Also accepts âchangeoâ.

  • ncpu (int, optional) â number of cpus for parallelization. Default is all available cpus.

  • dirs (str, optional) â If specified, out file will be in this location.

  • outFilePrefix (str, optional) â If specified, the out file name will have this prefix. None defaults to âdandelion_define_clonesâ

  • verbose (bool) â Whether or not to print the command used in terminal to call DefineClones.py. Default is False.

Returns

Return type

Dandelion object with clone_id annotated in .data slot and .metadata initialized.
